{"step_by_step_thinking": "Hematopoietic stem cells are the cells that give rise to all other blood cells. These cells are found in the bone marrow, which is the spongy tissue inside some of your bones, such as your hip and thigh bones. The thymus is where T cells mature, not where stem cells originate. Lymph nodes and the spleen are part of the lymphatic system, which is involved in the body's immune response, but they are not the origin of hematopoietic stem cells.", "answer_choice": "A"}
